get.description: Get a list of an organization's projects.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The requested version of the endpoint to process the request

parameters.name: starting_after
parameters.description: Return the page of results immediately after this cursor

parameters.name: ending_before
parameters.description: Return the page of results immediately before this cursor

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page

parameters.name: org_id
parameters.description: The id of the org to return a list of projects

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Return projects that prefix-match the provided name

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: Return projects that match the provided origin
Return projects that match the provided type
parameters.name: type
status
parameters.description: Return projects that match the provided status

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Return projects that match all provided tags

parameters.name: businessCriticality
parameters.description: Return projects that have at least 1 option

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Return projects that have at least 1 option

parameters.name: lifecycle
parameters.description: Return projects that have at least 1 option
Return projects that belong to the provided target
parameters.name: targetId

200.description: A list of projects is returned for the targeted org

snyk-version-requested.description: A header containing the version of the endpoint requested by the caller.

schema.name: version
schema.description: The requested version of the endpoint to process the request

snyk-version-served.description: A header containing the version of the endpoint that was served by the API.

schema.name: version
schema.description: The requested version of the endpoint to process the request

snyk-request-id.description: A header containing a unique id used for tracking this request. If you are reporting an issue to Snyk it's very helpful to provide this ID.

snyk-version-lifecycle-stage.description: A header containing the version stage of the endpoint. This stage describes the guarantees snyk provides surrounding stability of the endpoint.

deprecation.description:
A header containing the deprecation date of the underlying endpoint. For more information, please refer to the deprecation header RFC:
https://tools.ietf.org/id/draft-dalal-deprecation-header-01.html

sunset.description:
A header containing the date of when the underlying endpoint will be removed. This header is only present if the endpoint has been deprecated. Please refer to the RFC for more information:
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8594

x-envoy-to-remove-normalized-request-pat.description: An internal header used by Snyk's API-Gateway for analytics.

x-envoy-to-remove-org-public-id.description: An internal header used by Snyk's API-Gateway for analytics.

created.description: The date that the project was created on

origin.description: The origin the project was added from

type.description: The package manager of the project

status.description: Describes if a project is currently monitored or it is de-activated

hostname.description: The hostname for a CLI project, null if not set

400.description: Bad Request: A parameter provided as a part of the request was invalid.
